description: Since 2007, the 10 ERDF programmes in England have invested billions of pounds of funding into local projects.

details.body:
Overview

Across England, European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) investments have:

  • helped 25,932 new businesses to start or move into the local areas
  • created around 131,375 jobs for local people

(Figures correct at August 2017)

Projects funded by ERDF

The documents below provide a full list of all the projects funded by ERDF in England.

  • ERDF Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Convergence list of beneficiaries February 2017 (PDF, 60.1 KB, 4 pages)
  • ERDF Cornwall and Isles of Scilly list of beneficiaries January 2015 (PDF, 61.9 KB, 8 pages)
  • ERDF East Midlands list of beneficiaries November 2015 (PDF, 510 KB, 6 pages)
  • ERDF East of England list of beneficiaries January 2014 (PDF, 72.8 KB, 8 pages)
  • ERDF North East list of beneficiaries December 2015 (PDF, 150 KB, 5 pages)
  • ERDF North East summary of projects December 2015 (PDF, 933 KB, 114 pages)
  • ERDF North West list of beneficiaries April 2015 (PDF, 231 KB, 15 pages)
  • ERDF South East list of beneficiaries May 2014 (PDF, 29.4 KB, 1 page)
  • ERDF South West list of beneficiaries January 2015 (PDF, 38.3 KB, 2 pages)
  • ERDF West Midlands list of beneficiaries November 2015 (PDF, 460 KB, 5 pages)
  • ERDF Yorkshire and the Humber list of beneficiaries February 2016 (PDF, 427 KB, 46 pages)

The London ERDF programme is administered by the Greater London Authority (GLA). Details of ERDF London-funded projects are available on the GLA website.

Case studies

A number of case studies have been developed to demonstrate the impact that ERDF is having across England to local people, local business and the economy. There are more case studies on the European Commission’s UK website.

  • National ERDF Case Study Book (Edition 1) (PDF, 1.9 MB, 24 pages)
  • National ERDF Case Study Book (Edition 2) (PDF, 3.7 MB, 23 pages)

Annual implementation reports

Each programme provides an annual report for the European Commission in June explaining the progress made in the previous year. The latest reports for 2014 are available below.

  • ERDF Cornwall and Isles of Scilly annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 1.04 MB, 60 pages)
  • ERDF East Midlands annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 1.6 MB, 48 pages)
  • ERDF East of England annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 1.36 MB, 92 pages)
  • ERDF North East annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 2.03 MB, 71 pages)
  • ERDF North West annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 1.55 MB, 66 pages)
  • ERDF South East annual implementation report 2013 (PDF, 1.04 MB, 46 pages)
  • ERDF South West annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 1.31 MB, 44 pages)
  • ERDF West Midlands annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 1.55 MB, 58 pages)
  • ERDF Yorkshire and the Humber annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 2.87 MB, 112 pages)
  • ERDF London annual implementation report 2014 (PDF, 2.55 MB, 67 pages)

The ERDF London interim evaluation (PDF, 4.7MB) is available on the GLA website.

ERDF programmes details

Each ERDF programme in England has an operational programme detailing its aims over the lifetime of the programming period. Read more about the operational programmes.
